alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 25 at 4:45AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, Los Angeles. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall could trigger shallow debris flows. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 441 AM PST, Light to locally moderate rain continued across the advisory area, after 3 to 8 inches of rain have fallen. This will prolong the flooding risk and slow the recession of flood waters. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in continued flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Burbank, Griffith Park, Universal City, North Hollywood, Pasadena, Hollywood, Downtown Los Angeles, Van Nuys, Beverly Hills, Alhambra, Mount Wilson, Encino, Northridge, Santa Clarita, Chatsworth, Woodland Hills, Whittier, West Covina, Glendora and San Dimas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. The rain will likely trigger shallow mud and debris flows, minor rock falls, and flooding capable of localized damage, especially in steep terrain. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
